instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .

threads.title: Questions on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not powering on
threads.message:
I have this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B this machine did have water damage around the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>. i get no green light on the charger( even though i have 3.42v on the onewire) but no <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> coming from the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> which is where its created i believe... so i did some more checking around noticed that i get nothing on the charger Agate. i get 6.87v on one side of <RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR> (the resistance on <RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR> is .332 kh) and nothing on the other side.

any idea on that?

threads.title: Questions on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not powering on
threads.message:
I guess ISL is bad but check this....

Voltaje on pin 2 from ISL?? [COLOR=#B22222]Should be about 16V[/COLOR]
Voltage on pin 3 from ISL?? [COLOR=#B22222]Should be about 4V[/COLOR]
Resistance between pins 27/28 from ISL?? [COLOR=#B22222]Should be about 20 ohm[/COLOR]
Resistance between pins 17/18 from ISL?? [COLOR=#B22222]Should be about 2.6 ohm[/COLOR]
Voltage on F7040?? [COLOR=#B22222]Should be 12.6V[/COLOR]

threads.title: Questions on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not powering on
threads.message:
i don't think its the ISL, I've changed it twice. 
pin2 is 16.31v
pin3 is 3.98v
resistance between pins 27/28 20.3ohm
resistance between mins 17/18 2.63ohms
voltage on F7040 12.24v

threads.title: Questions on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not powering on
threads.message: Resistance to GND on <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>? The 12.23V on PPBUS suggests the SMC is not running

threads.title: Questions on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not powering on
Questions on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not powering on
threads.message: .494 is not a resistance measurement, probably diode mode. Measure again.

threads.title: Questions on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not powering on
threads.message: sorry i did have in diod mode before 0.396khms is what i get

threads.title: Questions on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not powering on
threads.message: 396 Ohms is way to low. Could be the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> or SMC usually. Start with pulling the 6259 and measuring again. Check for corrosion around SMC.
